Log a task-trace entry to the JSONL feedback file

Source: R/task_trace.R
log_task_trace.Rd

Appends a single JSONL entry to .rrlmgraph/task_trace.jsonl under the project root. The file is created automatically. Each entry records the query, the nodes that were surfaced, the feedback polarity, a timestamp, and the current session identifier.

Usage

log_task_trace(query, nodes, graph, polarity = 0)

Arguments

query

Character(1). The user query.

nodes

Character vector. Node names that were part of the context returned.

graph

An rrlm_graph / igraph object. Used to resolve the project root from the "project_root" graph attribute.

polarity

Numeric(1) in \([-1, 1]\). Feedback signal: \(> 0\) means the context was helpful, \(< 0\) means it was not, \(0\) (default) means neutral.

Value

The path to task_trace.jsonl, invisibly.

See also

update_task_weights(), update_task_polarity()

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
g <- build_rrlm_graph("mypkg")
log_task_trace("How does load_data work?", c("pkg::load_data"), g)
} # }
